item.title: 特朗普加强关税威胁，美国股市从历史高位回落
item.description: 美国股市周一扩大跌幅，从历史记录进一步下跌，原因是唐纳德-特朗普总统对欧洲和墨西哥发出的最新一轮关税威胁，使投资者在本周企业财报季启动之际保持紧张。【原文：US stocks extended declines Monday to fall further from records, as President Donald Trump’s latest salvo of tariff threats for Europe and Mexico kept investors on edge as corporate earnings season kicks off this week.】

item.title: 英国电网运营商上调电力需求增长预测
item.description: 据国家能源系统运营商称，由于人口增长率提高和经济电气化，英国电力需求的增幅将超过此前的预测。【原文：UK power demand is set to increase by more than previously forecast due to higher population growth rates and the electrification of the economy, according to the National Energy System Operator.】

item.title: 印度在收到报告后下令检查波音喷气机的燃油开关
item.description: 上个月，印度航空公司一架 787 客机因煤油供应中断而坠毁，印度民航局在收到有关该事故的初步报告后，已下令对在印度运营的波音公司 737 和 787 客机的驾驶舱燃料开关进行检查。【原文：India’s civil aviation authority has ordered an inspection of cockpit fuel switches on Boeing Co. 737 and 787 aircraft operating in the country following a preliminary report into the deadly crash of an Air India 787 last month that was caused by a cut-off in kerosene supply.】

item.title: 拉吉夫-詹恩（Rajiv Jain）的 GQG 推出首只 ETF，主动型基金竞争加剧
item.description: GQG Partners —；这家由资深投资者拉吉夫-贾恩（Rajiv Jain）于 2016 年联合创办的资产管理公司资产规模达 1,720 亿美元—；正在向 11 万亿美元 ETF 行业中竞争最激烈的一角发起冲击。【原文：GQG Partners — the $172 billion asset manager co-founded by veteran investor Rajiv Jain in 2016 — is launching into one of the most competitive corners of the $11 trillion ETF industry.】

item.title: 巴西关税引发供应风险，橙汁创四个月新高
item.description: 由于越来越多的人担心美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁对巴西商品征收50%的关税将抑制对美国的供应，橙汁期货在纽约升至三个月来的最高点。【原文：Orange juice futures rose to a three-month high in New York on mounting worries that President Donald Trump’s threat to slap a 50% tariff on Brazilian goods will curb supplies to the US.】

item.title: 美联储哈马克支持对利率采取观望姿态
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）表示，她希望看到通胀率进一步降低，然后才会支持降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said she wants to see inflation lowered further before she’d support a cut in interest rates.】

item.title: 日本引领全球长期债券下跌，消费成为焦点
item.description: 从日本、德国到英国和法国的长期债务收益率周一均有所上升，原因是人们对财政赤字扩大的担忧与日俱增，从而抑制了需求。【原文：Yields for long-term debt from Japan and Germany to the UK and France rose on Monday as growing concern over widening fiscal deficits dented demand.】

item.title: 电力游说团体称印度放宽污染标准有利于消费者
item.description: 印度电力生产商协会称，印度放宽发电厂二氧化硫排放标准将有利于消费者，避免因设备成本增加而导致电价上涨。【原文：India’s relaxed norms on sulfur dioxide emissions from power plants will favor consumers, avoiding higher electricity prices due to increased equipment costs, according to the Association of Power Producers.】

item.title: 股价暴跌，苹果面临重启人工智能战略的呼声
item.description: 苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：Apple Inc. is facing pressure to shake up its corporate playbook to invigorate its struggling artificial intelligence efforts.】

item.title: 西班牙中央银行任命美联储官员为新任首席经济学家
item.description: 西班牙银行任命美国联邦储备委员会官员大卫-洛佩斯-萨利多（David Lopez Salido）为首席经济学家。【原文：The Bank of Spain appointed US Federal Reserve official David Lopez Salido as chief economist.】

item.title: 高盛集团首席经济学家贝尔：欧洲股市对关税感到自满
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The rally in European stocks suggests investors have been miscalculating the risks of US tariffs, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s Sharon Bell.】

item.title: 高利率拖累市场，巴西 5 月经济大幅下滑
item.description: 巴西 5 月份的经济活动降幅远超预期，这表明高利率开始对这个拉丁美洲最大的经济体造成压力。【原文：Brazil’s economic activity dropped far more than expected in May, a signal that sky-high interest rates are starting to weigh on Latin America’s biggest economy.】

item.title: 维托尔以 2.4 亿美元的铁矿石交易扩大金属业务
item.description: 维托尔集团（Vitol Group）签署了首份多年期金属融资协议，这家能源贸易巨头在长期退出金属市场后，加大了在该领域的投入。【原文：Vitol Group signed its first multi-year financing deal for metals, as the energy trading giant ramps up its presence in the sector following a long stint out of the market.】

item.title: 钨生产商阿尔蒙特在美国上市融资 9000 万美元
item.description: Almonty Industries Inc.在纳斯达克上市时筹集了 9000 万美元，这家钨生产商正在努力确保其向美国国防市场供货的能力。【原文：Almonty Industries Inc. raised $90 million in its Nasdaq listing, as the tungsten producer moved to secure its ability to supply the US defense market.】

item.title: Castlelake 将购买高达 25 亿美元的 Pagaya 消费者贷款
item.description: Castlelake LP 已同意从金融技术公司 Pagaya Technologies 购买多达 25 亿美元的消费贷款，这是这家人工智能驱动型贷款公司的一系列交易中的最新一笔。【原文：Castlelake LP has agreed to purchase as much as $2.5 billion of consumer loans from financial technology firm Pagaya Technologies, the latest in a string of deals for the AI-driven lender.】

item.title: 具有影响力的华盛顿智囊团称中国芯片光刻技术落后
item.description: 中国在推进半导体光刻技术方面面临重大挑战，这是其实现技术自给自足和在与美国的贸易战中取得优势的关键障碍。【原文：China faces significant challenges advancing its semiconductor lithography, a key hurdle for its drive toward technological self-sufficiency and superiority in the trade war with the US.】

item.title: 人工智能使美国电力供应紧张，CoreWeave 数据中心将使城市电力需求翻番
item.description: CoreWeave 公司正在扩建一个数据中心，预计将使达拉斯附近一个城市的用电需求增加一倍，这是人工智能工作负载对美国电力供应造成压力的又一个例子。【原文：CoreWeave Inc. is expanding a data center that is projected to double the electricity needs of a city near Dallas, another example of the strains that artificial intelligence workloads are placing on the US power supply.】

item.title: 欧特克放弃收购软件公司 PTC
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，欧特克公司不再寻求收购 PTC 公司，这将成为今年最大的交易之一。【原文：Autodesk Inc. is no longer pursuing an acquisition of PTC Inc., people familiar with the matter said, which would have ranked as one of the year’s largest deals.】

item.title: 亿万富翁佩拉多仍想接管环球航空公司，对债务协议表示不满
item.description: 魁北克亿万富翁皮埃尔-卡尔-佩拉多（Pierre Karl Peladeau）表示，他不会放弃对 Transat AT 公司的长期追求，认为这家旅游公司最新的资产负债表操作仍使其背负过多债务。【原文：Quebec billionaire Pierre Karl Peladeau says he’s not giving up his long pursuit of Transat AT Inc., arguing the travel company’s latest balance-sheet maneuvers still leave it with too much debt.】

item.title: 特朗普 2.0 在管道安全监管问题上轻描淡写
item.description:
新政府立案的执法案件数量是至少二十年来最低的。【原文：

The number of enforcement cases opened by the new administration is the lowest in at least two decades.

item.title: 芯片制造商 Kioxia 计划首次在海外发行债券，加入日本同行行列
item.description: Kioxia Holdings Corp. 计划通过出售美元债券筹集多达 30 亿美元的资金，这将是该公司首次发行公司债券，这是海外投资者对日本公司票据（包括风险较高的公司）青睐有加的最新迹象。【原文：Kioxia Holdings Corp. plans to raise as much as $3 billion via a dollar bond sale that would be its first corporate debt issuance, in the latest sign of investor appetite abroad for Japanese company notes including riskier firms.】

item.title: 尽管刚果禁止钴出口，但中国钴业公司（CMOC）仍提高了钴产量
item.description: 尽管非洲国家禁止出口钴，但中国五矿集团有限公司（CMOC Group Ltd.）今年上半年在刚果民主共和国的两个矿山生产了更多的钴。【原文：China’s CMOC Group Ltd. produced more cobalt at its two mines in the Democratic Republic of Congo in the first half of this year, despite the African nation’s ban on exports.】

item.title: 黄仁勋在前往中国之际大谈英伟达对美国的战略价值
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，埃德-勒德洛（Ed Ludlow）将就英伟达（Nvidia）首席执行官关于人工智能硬件和基础设施的基本作用发表最新评论。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow addresses the latest commentary from Nvidia’s chief executive officer about the fundamental role of AI hardware and infrastructure.】

item.title: 中国摆脱关税影响，扩大制造业主导地位
item.description: 我是马尔科姆-斯科特，驻悉尼的国际经济编辑。今天，驻北京的贸易记者詹姆斯-梅杰（James Mayger）将探讨中国制造业的主导地位。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics editor in Sydney. Today, James Mayger, a trade reporter in Beijing, looks at China’s manufacturing dominance. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 特朗普关税针对美国大小贸易伙伴
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周六公布了致欧盟和墨西哥的信函，威胁要对这两个主要贸易伙伴的商品各征收 30% 的关税，这是一个重要的里程碑。如果他兑现了他的威胁，那么美国进口商必须支付新的高额税款的贸易额将增加到进入美国的商品价值的一半以上。【原文：With the letters unveiled Saturday to the European Union and Mexico threatening tariffs of 30% on each of the major trading partners’ goods, President Donald Trump passed a significant milestone. If he delivers on his threats, he’s increasing the amount of trade on which US importers will have to pay new elevated taxes to more than half the value of goods coming into the US.】

item.title: 利欧制药准备首次公开募股，从勃林格处购入皮肤药物
item.description: LEO Pharma A/S同意从勃林格殷格翰有限公司（Boehringer Ingelheim GmbH）手中收购皮肤病药物Spevigo的全球销售权，这家丹麦皮肤病专家将在计划于2026年首次公开募股之前加强其产品组合。【原文：LEO Pharma A/S agreed to acquire the global rights for skin disease drug Spevigo from Boehringer Ingelheim GmbH, as the Danish dermatology specialist strengthens its portfolio ahead of a planned initial public offering in 2026.】

item.title: 银行开始将博姿 42.5 亿美元的收购债务推向市场
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，银行正在寻求为博姿出售 22.5 亿美元的定期贷款和 20 亿美元的等值债券，以帮助其为美国私募股权公司 Sycamore Partners 的收购提供资金。【原文：Banks are looking to sell $2.25 billion of term loans and $2 billion equivalent of bonds for Boots, to help finance its acquisition by US private equity firm Sycamore Partners, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 教育科技公司麦格劳希尔寻求 5.37 亿美元 IPO
item.description: 麦格劳-希尔公司（McGraw Hill Inc.【原文：McGraw Hill Inc. is seeking to raise as much as $537 million in a US public offering, as the education firm joins a rising tide of mid-summer US listings.】

item.title: 报道称印尼称美国石油交易取决于关税谈判
item.description: 据当地新闻机构援引一位高级官员的话称，印尼购买价值数十亿美元的美国石油相关产品的计划取决于关税谈判的结果。【原文：Indonesia’s plan to buy billions of dollars’ worth of US oil-related goods depends on the outcome of tariff negotiations, according to a top official cited by local news outlets.】

item.title: 对于寻求无风险回报的基金而言，不良债务失去了光彩
item.description: 在这个充满冒险者的世界里，一些市场上最大的赌徒正在撤出他们的筹码。【原文：In a world brimming with risk takers, some of the market’s biggest gamblers are taking their chips off the table.】
